H0.text: What is the Japanese word for the sash worn as a belt in traditional dress (kimonos and martial arts uniforms, etc). Sashiko

H1.text: What is the Japanese word for the sash worn as a belt in traditional dress (kimonos and martial arts uniforms, etc). Hakama

H2.text: What is the Japanese word for the sash worn as a belt in traditional dress (kimonos and martial arts uniforms, etc). Fundoshi

H3.text: What is the Japanese word for the sash worn as a belt in traditional dress (kimonos and martial arts uniforms, etc). Obi

A4.text: The kimono is traditionally worn with a broad sash, called an obi.

A5.text: Sashiko are used to hold cloth together and decorate it.
